name: Aqua

faqs.a: Aqua keeps one balance spanning Bitcoin on-chain, the Liquid sidechain, and Lightning. You can also swap USDt to other chains through partners when needed.
No. The wallet is self-custodial. You only share an email if you opt into JAN3 services such as the Dolphin Card.

faqs.q: How do Lightning payments work in Aqua?
faqs.a: Aqua sends and receives Lightning through Boltz submarine swaps. You pay in L-BTC, Boltz settles over Lightning, and any refunds return to your Liquid balance.

faqs.q: Can I import an existing seed phrase into Aqua?
faqs.a: Aqua only restores wallets that were originally created inside the app. It generates a 12-word seed that you should store offline as your only backup.

faqs.q: How does Aqua handle USDt on other blockchains?
faqs.a: USDt on Liquid is native. When you send or receive USDt on networks like Ethereum or Tron, Aqua routes the transaction through swap providers such as SideShift or Changelly and their fees apply.

supported_network: Bitcoin, Lightning, and Liquid with USDt swaps via partners

WW.text: Bitcoin, Lightning, and Liquid in one balance
Confidential Liquid transactions for added privacy
Direct peg-in turns on-chain BTC into L-BTC without extra steps
Swaps can cost more than native Lightning wallets

open_source: Core wallet is open source; marketplace modules are closed
description:
Aqua is JAN3's mobile wallet that keeps Bitcoin, Liquid, and Lightning funds in one place. The app is self-custodial, so you write down a 12-word seed and control every transaction.

Aqua leans on Liquid for privacy and low fees, while Boltz swaps unlock Lightning spending without running your own channels. You can peg-in on-chain BTC, hold USDt on Liquid, and bridge to other networks when required.

Optional extras such as the Dolphin Card and future marketplace services build on the same wallet, so newcomers can start with simple payments and grow into more advanced features as they get comfortable.

tl_dr.best_for: Mobile Bitcoiners who want Liquid privacy and the option to spend over Lightning without running channels.
tl_dr.consider_if: You plan to hold USDt on Liquid or need the Dolphin Card for day-to-day expenses.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need rock-bottom Lightning fees or rely on desktop wallets.

steps.title: 1. Install and create your wallet
actions: Download Aqua from the App Store or Google Play
Create a new wallet and write the 12-word seed on paper
Add an optional passphrase if you want an extra layer
steps.gotcha: Aqua cannot import seeds from other wallets, so keep this new phrase safe.

steps.title: 2. Add funds
actions: Choose Receive and pick Bitcoin, Liquid, or Lightning
For large on-chain deposits, use Direct Peg-in to land funds directly as L-BTC
steps.gotcha: Lightning receives run through Boltz, so expect a short delay and a swap fee when capacity is low.

steps.title: 3. Pay or swap
actions: Tap Send and pick Lightning, Bitcoin, or USDt
Review the quoted fee before confirming
Use the swap screen to bridge USDt to other chains if required
steps.gotcha: Boltz and third-party providers charge extra for swaps; wait for low-fee periods if you're cost sensitive.

fees_scenarios.title: Pay someone
fees_scenarios.cost_today: 0.1% of the amount + Liquid network fee
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Aqua swaps L-BTC through Boltz to settle the Lightning invoice.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Batch payments when possible and send during low Liquid fee periods.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Boltz charges 0.1% plus the underlying Liquid mining fee when you send over Lightning.

fees_scenarios.title: Receive on Lightning
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Boltz receives the payment and credits your Liquid or Bitcoin balance.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Use Lightning sparingly for small payments and rely on on-chain or Liquid for bigger transfers.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Receiving Lightning through Aqua triggers a Boltz swap that currently costs 0.25% plus the Liquid mining fee.

fees_scenarios.title: Move USDt to another chain
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Aqua hands the transfer to SideShift or Changelly, who convert Liquid USDt to the destination chain.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Compare quotes and only bridge when you actually need funds on another network.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Swap partners set their own network fees, so conversions to chains like Ethereum or Tron cost more than staying on Liquid.

fees_faq.q: Why are Lightning fees higher than in other wallets?
fees_faq.a: Aqua relies on Boltz swaps instead of native channels, so the service charges percentage-based fees on top of the Liquid mining cost.

fees_faq.q: Can I choose which swap provider Aqua uses?
fees_faq.a: Not yet. The app automatically selects a partner today, but JAN3 plans to let you pick providers in a future release.

fees_faq.q: How do I keep swap fees predictable?
fees_faq.a: Check the quoted fee before confirming and prefer Liquid or on-chain payments when you do not need an instant Lightning settlement.

key_terms.definition: A trust-minimized service that turns your Liquid funds into Lightning payments and back.
A Bitcoin sidechain that adds faster settlement, confidential transactions, and native USDt support.
An Aqua feature that converts on-chain BTC straight into your L-BTC balance without extra manual steps.

data_flows: Aqua does not send analytics by default; optional JAN3 services only store the email you provide.
Lightning, USDt swaps, and support requests can expose metadata to providers such as Boltz, SideShift, Changelly, or Zendesk.
Seeds stay on your phone (Keychain on iOS, EncryptedSharedPreferences on Android).
recovery_drill: Back up the 12-word seed offline right after setup.
Test a small restore on another device before deleting the original installation.
If JAN3 ever shutters a service, you can still export funds using the seed in compatible wallets like Blockstream Green.
country_caveats: Dolphin Card availability depends on your country and compliance checks.
Swap liquidity varies by region; Boltz or SideShift may refuse large amounts in restricted jurisdictions.
Always download the app from the official app stores to avoid tampered APKs.

data_flows: Aqua does not log payments on JAN3 servers, but third-party swaps (Boltz, SideShift, Changelly) see the amounts they process.
Optional JAN3 accounts (for services like Dolphin) store your email only; no password is kept.
App store billing and crash reports still follow Apple and Google policies.
privacy.data_flows_do: Audit swap quotes and only share support details with providers you trust.
privacy.data_flows_dont: Assume swaps or Lightning transactions are invisible. Providers learn the amounts they route.
recovery: Seed lives solely on your device; JAN3 cannot recover it if you lose it.
To restore, install Aqua on a new phone, choose Restore Wallet, and enter the 12 words (plus passphrase if set).
If Boltz fails to settle, Aqua shows a Refund button so you can reclaim the funds.
privacy.recovery_do: Store the seed somewhere dry and offline; consider adding the optional passphrase if you share the device.
privacy.recovery_dont: Never screenshot or cloud-sync the seed.
region: Dolphin Card roll-out is phased; some regions cannot apply yet.
Swap partners may block certain countries based on compliance rules.
Install updates promptly. New builds often address security and fee issues.

micro_faqs.a: No. The wallet ships without analytics. Only optional services gather the email you volunteer.

micro_faqs.q: Can JAN3 recover my wallet if I lose the seed?
micro_faqs.a: No. The seed stays local, so recovery is entirely your responsibility.

micro_faqs.q: What happens if a Lightning swap fails?
micro_faqs.a: Boltz automatically refunds your Liquid balance. If it stalls, use the Refund button or contact the provider with the swap ID.

glossary.def: An optional email login for services like the Dolphin Card; not required for basic wallet use.
A Liquid feature that hides amounts while keeping addresses auditable.
A third party (Boltz, SideShift, Changelly) that converts between networks for you.

compat_heading: What this Aqua wallet can or can't do

compat_tiles.title: Pay with Lightning
compat_tiles.benefit: Via Boltz Swap fee applies

compat_tiles.title: Pay on-chain
compat_tiles.benefit: Bitcoin Liquid

compat_tiles.title: Receive on Lightning
compat_tiles.benefit: 0.25% swap fee Auto refunds if it fails

compat_tiles.title: Receive on-chain
compat_tiles.benefit: BTC & L-BTC addresses Direct peg-in

compat_explainers.why: Aqua routes Lightning payments through Boltz, so you can spend instantly without running a channel yourself.
try: Paste or scan the invoice and review the swap quote
Confirm and watch for the success banner
compat_explainers.gotcha: Boltz adds a fee and uses your Liquid balance. Heavy use can be more expensive than native Lightning wallets.

compat_explainers.why: Pay exchanges or merchants with either on-chain BTC or the faster Liquid network.
try: Pick Bitcoin or Liquid in the Send screen
Paste the address and set your fee
Confirm and wait for blockchain confirmations
compat_explainers.gotcha: Direct peg-out to mainnet still depends on third-party liquidity, so large withdrawals may take longer.

compat_explainers.why: Aqua lets you accept Lightning tips and swaps them into Liquid or Bitcoin automatically.
try: Set an amount and share the invoice
Keep the app open until Boltz confirms
compat_explainers.gotcha: Each Lightning receive costs 0.25% plus the Liquid fee, so small tips can get eaten by the charge.

compat_explainers.why: You can receive BTC or L-BTC with confidential amounts when using Liquid.
try: Choose Receive and pick Bitcoin or Liquid
Watch the transaction settle. Liquid confirms in 1 to 2 minutes
compat_explainers.gotcha: Liquid senders must also support Liquid. For mainnet BTC, direct peg-in avoids paying two separate transaction fees.

migration.title: Restore Aqua on a new phone
migration.choose: When you lose or upgrade your device and need the same wallet.
steps: Install Aqua from the official app store
Pick Restore Wallet and enter the 12-word seed (and passphrase if you set one)
Let the app rescan balances before deleting the old install
migration.tips: Keep the old phone offline until the new one finishes syncing to avoid confusion.
migration.gotcha: You cannot run the same seed on two phones at once.

migration.title: Another wallet → Aqua
migration.choose: When you want Liquid privacy or the Dolphin Card but currently use a different wallet.
steps: Create your Aqua wallet and back up the seed
Send a small test payment from your existing wallet to Aqua
Move the remainder once the test settles
migration.tips: Use Liquid or on-chain BTC for the transfer; Lightning swaps from other wallets will still incur fees.
migration.gotcha: You cannot import an old seed, so funds must physically move.

migration.title: Aqua → Long-term storage
migration.choose: When you want to vault BTC or USDt elsewhere.
steps: Send on-chain BTC or Liquid to your cold storage address
If moving BTC, consider peg-out timing when fees are low
Wait for confirmations before deleting Aqua
migration.tips: Liquid peg-outs rely on SideSwap liquidity; plan ahead for large amounts.
migration.gotcha: Peg-outs can take hours if SideSwap's hot wallet is empty.

migration.title: Aqua → Another wallet
migration.choose: When you need native Lightning or desktop support instead.
steps: Install the new wallet and complete its backup
Send a small test from Aqua using the network your new wallet prefers
migration.tips: Use on-chain transfers for large amounts to avoid repeated Boltz fees.
migration.gotcha: Deleting Aqua without moving funds loses access permanently.
